text: And so this is something, of course, that we can think about in any discussion of ethics And, and then towards the end, I'm going to talk about just, just the bigger picture of how that leads to a huge variety of unconventional beings with which we are going to share our world and already share our world and what we owe to these, to these beings That, that And so, and so that kind of brings us, brings us back full circle, right You can see this is kind of really a cycle, even though I've, I've, I've listed it linearly
content_summary: The speaker discusses the ethical considerations in scientific research, particularly in relation to unconventional beings. They emphasize the importance of understanding our co-existence with these beings and our responsibilities towards them.
